title: Georgia House - Day 4 (2026-12-04)
summary:
Here is a structured markdown summary of the Georgia House session transcript:

## Overview
The session focused on a morning devotional and prayer led by Pastor Lee May, a former county commissioner who is now a pastor. There was no substantive legislative action detected in the transcript.

## Key Actions
No bills were passed, referred, or introduced.

## Notable Moments
- Pastor Lee May, a former Dekalb County commissioner, delivered the morning devotional and prayer.
- Rep. Darshan Kendrick introduced Pastor May and recognized his guests from the church.
- Pastor May spoke about the parable of the Good Samaritan from the Book of Luke, relating it to the work of the legislature.
- Pastor May acknowledged that it was the 117th anniversary of the founding of his fraternity, Alpha Phi Alpha.

## Votes
No recorded votes detected.

## Attendance
The transcript notes that the Speaker asked all members to report to the floor and vote green to signify their presence before proceeding.

## Adjournment
The transcript does not mention the time of adjournment or the date of the next session.
